required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neurophysiological Characteristics of Subthalamic Deep-brain Stimulation (STN-DBS)
clinical_study.official_title: Neurophysiological Characteristics of Subthalamic Deep-brain Stimulation (STN-DBS) Under General Anesthesia for Patients With Parkinson's Disease or Dystonia and Their Correlation With Prognosis

collaborator.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The intraoperative neuroelectrophysiological signals were collected from patients undergoing STN-DBS under general anesthesia in the Neurosurgery Department of Wuhan union Hospital, and their preoperative conditions and postoperative efficacy will be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: The intraoperative neuroelectrophysiological signals were collected from patients undergoing STN-DBS under general anesthesia in the Neurosurgery Department of Wuhan union Hospital, and their preoperative conditions and postoperative efficacy will be evaluated. The intraoperative neuroelectrophysiological signals would be analyzed.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Ethics application has not been completed yet

primary_outcome.description: UPDRS has four parts: part I (nonmotor experiences of daily living, total score=16); part II (patient motor experience of daily living, total score=52); part III (clinician motor examination, total score=56); part IV (complications, total score=23). The total score of all the four parts is147. Higher scores means a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Burke Fahn Marsden's Dystonia Rating Scales(BFMDRS)
primary_outcome.description: BFMDRS has two parts: BFMDRS movement part (BFMDRS-M) and BFMDRS disability part (BFMDRS-D). The total score of BFMDRS-M is 120 and the total score of BFMDRS-D is 30. Higher scores means a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Patients with Parkinson's disease or dystonia and underwent STN DBS under general anesthesia in neurosurgery department

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Parkinson's disease or dystonia and STN-DBS in neurosurgery department of Wuhan Union Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients underwentSTN-DBS in neurosurgery department of Wuhan Union Hospital.
2. Patients with Parkinson's disease or dystonia.
Exclusion Criteria:
1.Patients without enough follow-up length.

overall_official.affiliation: Neurosurgery department of Wuhan Union Hospital

reference.citation: Tsai ST, Kuo CC, Chen TY, Chen SY. Neurophysiological comparisons of subthalamic deep-brain stimulation for Parkinson's disease between patients receiving general and local anesthesia. Ci Ji Yi Xue Za Zhi. 2016 Apr-Jun;28(2):63-67. doi: 10.1016/j.tcmj.2016.02.003. Epub 2016 Apr 10.

Yamada K, Goto S, Kuratsu J, Matsuzaki K, Tamura T, Nagahiro S, Murase N, Shimazu H, Kaji R. Stereotactic surgery for subthalamic nucleus stimulation under general anesthesia: a retrospective evaluation of Japanese patients with Parkinson's disease. Parkinsonism Relat Disord. 2007 Mar;13(2):101-7. Epub 2006 Oct 19.
